intro: Kotschya recurvifolia subsp. longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved kotschya, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, recurved leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its flowers are often clustered in inflorescences and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. The subspecies is distinguished by its longer leaves compared to other subspecies of Kotschya.
